oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Charlotte Street Church of Christ: side and south elevations
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of Charlotte Street Church of Christ's side and south elevations. The gable-fronted building, constructed of concrete blocks, contains three bays of windows on the side and two bays of windows on the rear. A rear addition features a side door, three-step stoop, and a hip roof.

Charlotte Street Church of Christ, located in Dickson County, Tennessee, is a rural African American church. The current building, dating to 1940, is constructed of concrete blocks. At the time of fieldwork, Joe Kpana-Quamoh served as minister and the property was deemed "probably eligible."
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
